paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on KCNH2 variants, including penetrance data and functional studies.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Prolonged repolarization and susceptibility to arrhythmias
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The KCNH2 variant hiPSC-CMs phenocopied the key features of LQT2.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Prolonged repolarization and susceptibility to arrhythmias
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The KCNH2 variant hiPSC-CMs phenocopied the key features of LQT2.

functional_data.summary: Both KCNH2 variants resulted in impaired glycosylation of the hERG protein.

variants.additional_notes: The KCNH2-A561T mutation was associated with a dominant-negative effect.
key_quotes: Blocking the hERG channel revealed that the pore-loop mutation conferred greater susceptibility to arrhythmic events.
Both KCNH2 variants result in impaired glycosylation of the hERG protein.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Prolonged repolarization and susceptibility to arrhythmias
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The KCNH2 variant hiPSC-CMs phenocopied the key features of LQT2.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Prolonged repolarization and susceptibility to arrhythmias
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The KCNH2 variant hiPSC-CMs phenocopied the key features of LQT2.

functional_data.summary: Both KCNH2 variants resulted in impaired glycosylation of the hERG protein.

variants.additional_notes: The KCNH2-N996I mutation was associated with a haploinsufficiency effect.
key_quotes: Blocking the hERG channel revealed that the tail mutation conferred less susceptibility to arrhythmic events compared to the pore-loop mutation.
Both KCNH2 variants result in impaired glycosylation of the hERG protein.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
